com.jakewharton.rxrelay2

Class Relay<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.reactivex.Observable<T>
      • com.jakewharton.rxrelay2.Relay<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the item value type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T>, io.reactivex.ObservableSource<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BehaviorRelay, PublishRelay, ReplayRelay

    public abstract class Relay<T>
extends io.reactivex.Observable<T>
implements io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T>
    Represents a Consumer and an Observable at the same time, allowing multicasting events from a single source to multiple child Observers.

    All methods except accept(T) are thread-safe. Use toSerialized() to make it thread-safe as well.

      abstract void accept(T value)
      abstract boolean hasObservers()
      Returns true if the subject has any Observers.
      Relay<T> toSerialized()
      Wraps this Relay and serializes the calls to accept(T), making it thread-safe.
